source_sentence: 生者皆歸死　　容顏盡變衰　　強力病所侵　無能免斯者　　假使妙高山　　劫盡皆散壞　大海深無底　　亦復皆枯竭　　大地及日月　時至皆歸盡　　未曾有一法　　不被無常吞大方廣佛華嚴經海印道場十重行願常徧禮懺儀卷第二十四
translation: All beings return to death, their appearance completely declines, and they are attacked by powerful diseases from which there is no escape. Suppose a high, marvelous mountain were to disintegrate at the end of an eon, the depth of the ocean is bottomless, and it all withers up, the earth and the sun and moon all return to extinction at the end of time. There has never been a single dharma that has not been swallowed by impermanence.
